info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 8 at 10:22PM CDT until July 8 at 11:45PM CDT by NWS Chicago IL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast Illinois, including the following county, Cook.
* WHEN...Until 1145 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Underpasses may be flooded. Roads and streets may be flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1022 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chicago, Oak Park, Irving Park, Lake View, West Town, Lincoln Park, Austin, Logan Square, Albany Park, Humboldt Park, Uptown, Edgewater, Portage Park, Belmont Cragin, Dunning, Avondale, North Center, Lincoln Square, Jefferson Park and Hermosa. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM CDT THIS EVENING
